text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: It is our attitude towards events, not events themselves, which we can control. Nothing is by its own nature calamitous - even death only if we fear it.
author: Epictetus

text: One thing only I know, and that is I know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: I and I alone am responsible for How I think and feel.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: A popular man arouses the jealousy of the powerful.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The learning of the wise, the justice of the great, the prayers of the righteous and the valor of the brave. All of these are as nothing without a ruler who knows the art of ruling. Make that the science of your tradition.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Mood? What has mood to do with it? You fight when the necessity aries - no matter the mood! Mood's a thing for cattle or making love or playing the baliset. It's not for fighting.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Any road followed precisely to its end leads precisely nowhere. Climb the mountain just a little bit to test that its a mountain. From the top of the mountain, you cannot see the mountain.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Here I am, Here I remain.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Be prepared to appreciate what you meet.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Most civilizations are based on cowardice. It's so easy to civilize by teaching cowardice. You water down the standards which would lead to bravery. You restrain the will. You regulate the appetites. You fence in the horizons. You make a law for every movement. You deny the existence of chaos. You teach event the children to breathe slowly. You take.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Most believe that a satisfactory future requires a return to an idealized past, a past which never in fact existed.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: History is a constant race between invention and catastrophe. Education helps but it's never enough.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The concept of progress acts as a protective mechanism to shield us from the terrors of the future.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: It's shocking to find how many people do not believe they can learn, and how many believe learning to be difficult.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The mind commands the body and it obeys. The mind orders itself and meets resistance.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Try looking into that place where you dare not look. You'll find me there staring at you.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: The willow submits to the wind and prospers until one day it is many willows - a wall against the wind.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: It is a curious thing, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
author: Frank Herbert [Dune]

text: Having your cash lose 5% from inflation is better than losing it 100% from a bad investment.
author: Morgan Housel

text: Trust no one who doesn't have to be accountable for their action.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: The more complicated an investment, the better probability of it being a scam.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: If everyone's doing it, I won't be doing it, or better try to look at it from the shovel perspective.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: The better investment will always be something you can control vs something you cannot.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
author: Mark Twain

text: Courage is resistance to fear. Mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: A fancy website and slick copywriting doesn't mean it's legit.
author: Probably Me

text: Win the game to not play it again.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: What is admired in one generation is abhorred in another. We cannot say who will survive the holocaust of memory. We are men only, a brief flare of the torch.
author: Madeline Miller [The Song of Achilles]

text: Do not let what you gained this day be so easily lost.
author: Madeline Miller [The Song of Achilles]

text: A tinker's debt is always paid. One for any simple trade. Twice for freely-given aid. Thrice for any insult made.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: The key is to keep the proper amount in your purse. Two little and they would be disappointed and prime to look for more. Too much and they would be excited and might get greedy.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Only priests and fools are fearless, and I've never been on the best of terms with Gods.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: A clever thoughtless person is one of the most terrifying things there is.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Remember: There are three things all wise men fear, the sea in storm, a night  with no moon, and the anger of a gentleman.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: If you possess too much power, people don't dare point out your mistakes. Power can be a terrible thing.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Beautiful game: The point is to be bold. To be dangerous. Be Elegant. Any man that’s half awake can spot a trap that’s laid for him. But to stride in boldly with a plan to turn it on its ear, that is a marvelous thing. To set a trap and know someone will come in wary, ready with a trick of their own, then beat them. That is twice marvelous.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: You've deduced a universal truth: things are usually unfair.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: It's the question we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right time.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: So when I meet a woman, I should simply say, 'You are beautiful'? No. You should say simply 'beautiful' and let the woman decide the rest of what you mean.
author: Patrick Rothfuss [The Name of the Wind]

text: If you added up all the time wasted searching for shortcuts and trying to cheat the process, the hard work could have already been done by now.
author: James Clear [Habit Guy]

text: Many of us seek community solely to escape the fear of being alone. Knowing how to be solitary is central to the art of living. When we can be alone we can be with others without using them as a means escape.
author: Bell Hooks [All about love]

text: When your sample is large, no single instance will significantly change the aggregate or the total.
author: Some Math Guy

text: We build toys. Some of those toys change the world.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Missing a train is only painful if you run after it. Not matching the idea of success other expect from you is only painful if that's what you are seeking.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: You stand above the rat race and the pecking order, not outside of it, if you do so by choice.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: I'm beginning to think decisiveness is overrated but I reserve the right to change my mind.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does
author: Charles Darwin [The Descent of Man]

text: Great thinkers don’t harbor doubts because they’re impostors. They maintain doubts because they know we’re all partially blind and they’re committed to improving their sight. They don’t boast about how much they know; they marvel at how little they understand. They’re aware that each answer raises new questions, and the quest for knowledge is never finished. A mark of lifelong learners is recognizing that they can learn something from everyone they meet. Arrogance leaves us blind to our weaknesses. Humility is a reflective lens: it helps us see them clearly. Confident humility is a corrective lens: it enables us to overcome those weaknesses.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: The absence of conflicts is not harmony, it's apathy.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: Note to self: on my next trip to the top of mount stupid, remember to take selfie.
author: Self

text: A weak argument generally dilutes a strong one.
author: A skilled Negotiators

text: We won't have much luck changing other people's mind if we refuse to change ours.
author: A skilled Negotiators

text: Even the devil appreciates being listened to
author: The Devil

text: It takes humility to reconsider our past commitments, doubt to question our present decisions and curiosity to re imagine our future plans. What we discover along the way can free us from the shackles of our familiar surroundings and our former selves. Rethinking liberates us to do more than update our knowledge and opinions its a tool for leading a more fulfilling life.
author: Adam Grant [Think Again]

text: Man was not made to belong to a group. Nor is he strictly an individual. For the concept of an individual can only exist when there simultaneously exists the concept of a group.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Belief is a useless concept. There is only knowing and not knowing.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Do whatever you like. Live in accordance with your sensibilities. Live and work in accordance with your own inspirations. This is your day to day existences. This is your life. What does god have to do with it?
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Because people are clever. They play ingenious little games with God. They offer a nickel and ask for a fortune. God is simply an insurance policy for them. They have no desire to know him or become him. They seek only to fortify their meager little lives with a few pleasant distractions and a modest seek of wealth and comfort. The kingdom of God is for the rarest man in the world. Millions speak of it. Only one purse it.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: You are drowning in a lake, do you weigh possibility and impossibility? Or do you simply act.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Anything of great value has great price. If you are asking for no less than God himself, you must give no less than your entire self.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The ego is not that which says that you are great. It is that which says that you exist at all. Confusion is a wonderful thing.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The greatest freedom that we have is the freedom to walk away from ourselves.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The king is not the one who possess wealth, the king is the one who is whilst possessing it, remains unattached to it. Because he doesn't feel an intimate ownership of it, he is not owned by it.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The man who knows that he will be a success makes 'hard work' work for him. To him it is a tool in his arsenal. The man who doesn't know, works for hard work. He relives upon hard work as the engine and vehicle to get him there. And this lather instance rarely works.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The trouble with mindfulness is that it requires persistent effort. It is like attempting to empty the ocean with a teacup.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Thoughts feel like imposters. Ideas seem like noise. Preferences fail to move you. Pride is easily dropped.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: The greatest thing that you can give to the world is peace in your own life.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Miserable is what a man becomes when he hankers for happiness.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Can rain come without the invitation of the cloud.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: A part of relishes getting angry. For when you do, you are able to exercise your right to become angry. You enjoy this right. For you feel that you have been wronged, and thus your anger is justified. You do not wish to pass up on exercising this right. But another part of you feel remorse for having been angry. And this remorse is to some degree, disingenuous. The remorse makes you feel better and morally correct. For if you had felt good about getting angry, you would have a difficult time accepting yourself.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: Buddha did not try to change the world. He turned himself into a Buddha. And because he did, the world began to change.
author: Kapil Gupta [Atamamun]

text: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, it to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't do.
author: Henry Ford

text: Goal that are challenging are motivators; goals that are impossible is just depressing.
author: Probably Me

text: If a competitor can out execute a startup once the idea is known, the startup is doomed anyway. The reason to build a new team to pursue an idea is that you believe you can accelerate through the Build-Measure-Learn feedback loop faster than anyone else can.
author: Eric Ries

text: Keep strong, if possible. In any case, keep cool. Have unlimited patience. Never corner an opponent, and always assist him to save face. Put yourself in his shoes - so as to see thing through his eyes. Avoid self-righteousness like the devil - nothing is so self-blinding.
author: Stillness is the Key

text: If you have the power to change the world, then that power can be used to destroy it as well.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: My dear friend, the entire point of life is to find ways to get others to do your work for you. Don't you know anything about basic economics?
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: I consider myself to be a man of principle. But, what man does not? Even the cut throat, I have noticed, considers his actions 'moral' after a fashion. Perhaps another person, reading my life, would name me a tyrant. He would call me arrogant. What is to make that man's opinion any less valid than my own? I guess it all comes down to one fact. In the end, I am the one with the armies.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: The best liars are those who tell the truth most of the time.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: The nature of life. It must change.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: Belief isn't simply a thing for fair times and bright days, What is belief, What is faith - if you don't continue in it after failure?
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: King don't argue. They command.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: A good king is one who is trusted by his people and one who deserve that trust.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: One nice thing about book and notes is that they would always wait for another time.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: The mark of a great man is one who knows when to set aside the important things in order to accomplish the vital ones.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: The white puffy thing that float high above the fruitful land where the seeds are planted
author: Definitely not me

text: Great every morning with a smile. That way it won't know what you're planning to do to it.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: WASING THE ALWAYS OF WANTING OF KNOWING.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Mistborn Series]

text: All men dream; but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds Awake to find that it was vanity; But the dreamers of day are dangerous men. That they may act their dreams with open eyes to make it possible.
author: T.E Lawrence [A dangerous man]

text: History has proven that those who dare to imagine the impossible are the ones who break all human limitations.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

text: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.
author: Antoine de Saint Exupéry

text: You know I really wish I listened to my mother in a time like this. Why, What did she tell you? I don't know, I din't listen.
author: Douglas Adams [The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]

text: Life before death, strength before weakness, journey before destination.
author: Brandon Sanderson [Stormlight Archive]

text: Getting extraordinary results is all about creating a domino effect in your life. The key is over time. Success is built sequentially. It's one thing at a time.
author: Garry Keller [The ONE thing]

text: I bargained with Life for a penny, and Life would pay no more, However I begged at evening When I counted my scanty store; Life is a just employer. He gives you what you ask, But once you have set the wages, Why, you must bear the task. I worked for a menial's hire, Only to learn, dismayed, That any wage I had asked of Life, Life would have willingly paid.
author: Jessie B. Rittenhouse

text: Hesitation is defeat.
author: Isshin, the Sword Saint [Sekiro]

text: Don't you dare go hollow.
author: Dark soul [Best game]

text: Once you've got a task to do, it's better to do it than live with the fear of it.
author: Logan Ninefinger [The first Law series]

text: In the pursuit of great, we failed to do good.
author: Viktor [Arcane]

text: When you are going to change the world, don't ask for permission.
author: Viktor [Arcane]

text: It is better to be feared than love. Fear you can control, Love you cannot.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged.
author: Heinrich Heine

text: Perhaps that was the moment you grew up, when you learned your parents were just as fallible as everyone else.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: The wiser a man is, the more he stands ready to be educated.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: Hope for the best and prepare fore the worst.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: Clever things are said with short words. Long ones are used to hide stupidity.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: Vital to look decisive, especially when you haven't a bloody clue what you're doing.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: The Great Leveller cancels all debt.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: Act as if everything is going exactly according to your plans. As if you are the most confident person in the world. As if you never had a doubt in your life.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: Absolutes are never to be trusted.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: What really happened don't matter half so much as what people want to hear.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: It's a comfort, telling yourself there's some big right thing out there. That you could seek some wise old bastard in the mountains who's got the answer. Then there'd be no need for doubts and regrets.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: If you have one person you're influenced by, everyone will say you're the next whoever, But if you rip off a hundred people, everyone will say you're so original.
author: Austin Kleon [Steal like an artist]

text: Whenever you're at a loss of what move to make next, just ask yourself, 'What would make a better story?'
author: Austin Kleon [Steal like an artist]

text: Draw the art you want to see, start the business you want to rum, play the music you want to hear, write the books you want to read, build the product you want to use - do the work you want to see done.
author: Austin Kleon [Steal like an artist]

text: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas, if your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
author: Austin Kleon [Steal like an artist]

text: What's your birthplace for you? A spawn point.
author: A random redditor

text: Good men are remembered with love by their friends. Great men are remembered with awe by their enemies.
author: Joe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: The way to defend a chess master was not with greater genius, but by forcing her to play a different game
author: A random redditorJoe Abercrombie [The first Law series]

text: You may have a desire, a wish, a dream but it's got to be more than that. You've gotta want it to the point that it hurts. Most people never reach that point.
Every storm runs out of rain.
There are always more of them before they are counted.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: A little awareness, a little empathy, it doesn't make us soft. It gives us confidence.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: Don't worry about whether things will be hard. Because they will be.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: When you feel you can't go on, know that you're just getting started.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: You won't take a bullet for pleasure or power, but you will for meaning.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: Diversity in counsel, unity in command.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it, and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: One man with courage makes a majority.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: It is the cowardice of others that creates the opportunities for the individual hero.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: When events become grave, and peril pressing, a sort of tidal wave pushes men of character into the front rank.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: One man with courage makes a majority.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: It's not our question to ask. For it is we who are being asked the question.
author: Man Search for Meaning

text: Look for a partner you'll try to impress daily, and one who will try to impress you.
author: Unknown

text: Those who fail to learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

text: For a few seconds of embarrassing bravery we can be great.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: A stoic is someone who says 'Fuck you' to fate.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: Procrastination is the soul rebelling against entrapment.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: We are scared of idleness because stopping would mean having to really consider what we want out of life and what we currently have. Sometimes, the gap feels so wide, we'd rather stay on the hamster wheel.
author: Ryan Holiday [Courage is calling]

text: Be forced to get good at making money.
author: Unknown

text: I will speak only when I'm certain what I'll say isn't better left unsaid.
author: Cato

text: It is better to have people ask why there wasn't a statue in your honor than why there was.
author: Cato

text: Lameness is a hindrance to the leg, but not to your ability to choose. Say this to yourself with regard to everything that happens, then you will see such obstacles as hindrances to something else, but not to yourself.
author: Epictetus

text: The robbed that smiles, steals something from the thief.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Do what you must, let happen what may.
author: Pierre Hadot [The Inner Citadel: The Meditations of Marcus Aurelius]

text: There are wicked men - they are useful to thee; without them what need would there be for virtue?
author: Apollonius

text: Today a drop of semen, tomorrow a pile of ash or bones. Not eternal but mortal; a part of the whole, as an hour is of the day. Like an hour I must come and like an hour pass away.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: You don't learn, then start. You start, then learn.
author: Sahil Lavingia [The minimalist Entrepreneur]

text: It is the community that leads you to the problem, which leads you to the product, which leads you to your business.
author: Sahil Lavingia [The minimalist Entrepreneur]

text: Once you've found community - you fit, start contributing with the intention of becoming a pillar in that community.
author: Sahil Lavingia [The minimalist Entrepreneur]

text: Focus on community before process, process before product, sales before marketing, and marketing before growth.
author: Sahil Lavingia [The minimalist Entrepreneur]

text: Om is the bow; The arrow is soul. Brahman is the arrow's mark. Strike it with steady aim.
author: Hermann Hesse [Siddhartha]

text: You are absent of cause or excuse. So self-indulgent and self-referential. No audience could ever want you. You crave the applause yet hate the attention. Then miss it, your act is a ruse. It is empty, Achilles, so end it all now. It's a pointless resistance for youYou crave the applause, yet hate the attention, then miss it
author: Achilles Come Down [Gang of Youths]

text: Never outshine your master.
author: 1st Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Never put too much trust in friends. Learn to use enemies.
author: 2nd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Conceal your intentions.
author: 3rd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Always say less than necessary.
author: 4th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: So much depends on reputation, guard it with your life.
author: 5th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Court attention at all cost.
author: 6th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Get others to do the work for you. But always take the credit.
author: 7th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Make other people come to you, use bait if necessary
author: 8th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Win through your action, never through argument.
author: 9th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Infection: avoid the unhappy or the unlucky.
author: 10th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Learn to keep people dependent on you.
author: 11th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Use selective honesty and generosity to disarm your victim.
author: 12th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: When asking for help, appeal to people's self interest, never their mercy or gratitude.
author: 13th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Pose as a friend, work as a spy.
author: 14th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Crush your enemy totally.
author: 15th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Use absence to increase strength and honor.
author: 16th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Keep others in suspended terror, cultivate an air of unpredictability.
author: 17th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Do not build a fortress to protect yourself, isolation is dangerous.
author: 18th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Know who you are dealing with, do not offend the wrong person.
author: 19th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Do not commit to anyone.
author: 20th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Play a sucker to catch a sucker, seem dumber than your mark.
author: 21st Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Use the surrender tactic: Transform weakness into power.
author: 22nd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Concentrate your forces.
author: 23rd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Play the perfect courtier.
author: 24th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Play on People's need to believe to create a cult like following.
author: 27th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Enter action with boldness.
author: 28th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Plan all the way to the end.
author: 29th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Make your accomplishments seem effortless.
author: 30th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Control the options, get other to play with the card you deal.
author: 31st Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Play to people's fantasies.
author: 32nd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Discover each man thumbscrew.
author: 33rd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Be royal in your own fashion. Act like a king to be treated like one.
author: 34th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Master the art of timing.
author: 35th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Strike the shepherd and the sheep will scatter.
author: 42nd Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Preach the need to change, but never reform too much at once.
author: 45th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Never appear too perfect.
author: 46th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Do not go past the mark you aimed for. In victory, know when to stop.
author: 47th Law, Robert Greene [48 law of power]

text: Fragile items break under stress, antifragile items get better from it.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: In order for a system to be antifragile, most of its parts must be fragile.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: You want to be phoenix, or possibly Hydra. Otherwise the sword of Damocles will get you.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: The true hero in the Black Swan world is someone who prevents a calamity and, naturally, because the calamity did not take place, does not get recognition
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Entrepreneurs are selected to be just doers, not thinkers, and doers do, they don't talk.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Be ready and willing to watch your mind create its little melodrama.
author: Untethered Soul

text: Fragile items break under stress, antifragile items get better from it.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

text: Death is the day worth living for.
author: Death himself

text: Good writing has an aliveness that keeps the reader reading from one paragraph to the next, and it's not a question of gimmicks to 'personalize' the author. It's a question of using the English language in a way that will achieve the greatest clarity and strength.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: A clear sentence is no accident. Very few sentences comes out right the first time, or even the third time. Remember this in moments of despair. If you find that writing is hard, it's because it is hard.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Clutter is the official language used by corporations to hide their mistakes.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Leaders who bob and weave like aging boxers don't inspire confidence. Same for writers. Believe in your own identity and your own opinions. Writing is an act of ego, and you might as well admit it.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Reader's want a writer who believes in himself and in what he is saying. Don't diminish that belief. Don't be kind of bold. Be bold.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: The best gift you have to offer when you write personal history is the gift of yourself. Give yourself permission to write about yourself, and have a good time doing it.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Always start with too much material. Then give your reader just enough.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Vulnerability has a strength of its own.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: The way to warm up any institution is to locate the missing 'I' Remember: 'I' is the most interesting element in any story.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: The trick is to study writers who have taste. Never hesitate to imitate another writer. Imitate one, you will be a thief. Imitate hundreds, you will find your voice.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Go with what seems inevitable in your own heritage. Embrace it and it may lead you to eloquence.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Dying is no big deal, living is the trick.
author: Death himself

text: If you want your writing to convey enjoyment, write about people your respect.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Quest: An act of faith we never get tired of hearing.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Writing is linear and sequential, the logic is the glue that holds it together that tension must be maintained from one sentence to the next and from paragraph to the next and from one section to the next, and narrative - good old fashioned storytelling - is what should pull your readers along without their noticing tug.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Self-discipline bordering on masochism is required for rewrite.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Your biggest stories will often have less to do with their subject than with their significance not what you did in a certain situation, but how that situation affected you & shaped the person you became.
author: William Zinsser [On Writing Well]

text: Don't be afraid to lose a customer. Bye!
author: That's me

text: Sometimes it benefits us to be passive to allow life to come to us and unfold without force. Other times it benefits us to be aggressive; to bend the world to will and actively shape the life we want. Are you being too passive or too aggressive right now?
author: A stoic question

text: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.
author: Terry Pratchett [Reaper Man]

text: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
author: Terry Pratchett [Diggers]

text: I meant,' said Ipslore bitterly, 'what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile? 'Death thought about it. CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.
author: Terry Pratchett [Sourcery]

text: It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: If you trust in yourself. . .and believe in your dreams. . .and follow your star. . . you'll still get beaten by people who spent their time working hard and learning things and weren't so lazy.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
author: Heraclitus

text: Out of every one hundred men, ten shouldn't even be there, eighty are just targets, nine are the real fighters, and we are lucky to have them, for they make the battle. Ah but the one, one is a warrior, and he will bring the others back.
author: Heraclitus

text: A legendary hero is usually the founder of something—the founder of a new age, the founder of a new religion, the founder of a new city, the founder of a new way of life. In order to found something new, one has to leave the old and go on a quest of the seed idea, a germinal idea that will have the potential of bringing forth that new thing.
author: Joseph Campbell [The Hero with a Thousand Faces]

text: The laws that govern circumstances are abolished by new circumstances.
author: Napoleon

text: Accept the fact that nothing is certain and no law or strategy is fixed. The best way to protect yourself is to be as fluid and formless as water; never bet on stability or lasting order. Everything changes.
author: Robert Greene

text: Being unconquerable lies with yourself.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Nature has made up her mind that what cannot defend itself shall not be defended.
author: Ralph Waldo

text: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams [The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]

text: We don't rise to the level of our expectations, we fall to the level of our training.
author: Unknown

text: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
author: Ryan Holiday [Discipline is Destiny]

text: He kept going, He had experience with this. He knew that little voice in his head, the voice of fatigue and weakness, did not always need to be heeded.
author: Ryan Holiday [Discipline is Destiny]

text: Such is the paradox of success. Precisely when we think we've earned the right to relax, our discipline is exactly when we need it most.
author: Ryan Holiday [Discipline is Destiny]

text: He didn't bother the gods, and he hoped the gods wouldn't bother him. Life was quite complicated enough.
author: Terry Pratchett [Mort]

text: Scientist have calculated that the chance of anything so patently absurd actually existing are millions to one. But magicians have calculated that million-to-one chances crop up nine times out of ten.
author: Terry Pratchett [Mort]

text: When your spirit is not in the least clouded, when the clouds of bewilderment clear away, there is the true void.
author: Miyamoto Musashi [The Book of Five Rings]

text: Stand in the sun; that is, take up an attitude with the sun behind you.
author: Miyamoto Musashi [The Book of Five Rings]

text: When you attack and the enemy quickly retreats, as you see him tense you must feint a cut. Then as he relaxes, follow up and hit him.
author: Miyamoto Musashi [The Book of Five Rings]

text: The ancient commanders of armies, who well know the powerful influence of necessity, and how it inspired the soldiers with the most desperate courage, neglected nothing to subject their men to such a pressure.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: You must declare unceasing war on yourself. As a warrior in life, you welcome combat and conflict as ways to prove yourself, to better your skills, to gain courage, confidence, and experience.
author: Robert Greene

text: First, become aware of the weakness and illness that can take hold of the mind, warping its strategic powers. Second, Declare a kind of war on yourself to make yourself move forward. Third, wage ruthless and continual battle on the enemies within you by applying certain strategies.
author: Robert Greene

text: War, or any kind of conflict, is waged and won through strategy. Think of strategy as a series of lines and arrows aimed ata goal; at getting you to a certain point in the world, at helping you to attack a problem in your path, at figuring out how to encircle and destroy your enemy. Before directing these arrows at your enemies, however, you must first direct them at yourself.
author: Robert Greene

text: Political thought and political instinct prove themselves theoretically nad practically in the ability to distinguish friend and enemy. The high point of politics are simultaneously the moments in which the enemy is, in concrete clarity, recognized as enemy.
author: Robert Greene

text: Don't depend on the enemy not coming, depend rather on being ready for him.
author: Robert Greene

text: When you are faced with a new situation, it is often best to imagine that you know nothing and that you need to start learning all over again.
author: Robert Greene

text: When you are faced with a new situation, it is often best to imagine that you know nothing and that you need to start learning all over again.
author: Robert Greene

text: Would you have a great empire? Rule over yourself.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Knowing your limits will expand your limits, getting the most out of what you have will let you have most.
author: Robert Greene

text: The value of trust comes from the possibility of being betrayed.
author: Unknown

text: Power is not only what you have but what the enemy thinks you have.
author: RUles for Radicals

text: Even in prison your time is your own.
author: Unknown

text: Retreat must never be an end in itself; at some point you have to turn around and fight. If you don't retreat is more accurately called surrender: the enemy wins. Combat is in the long run unavoidable. Retreat can only be temporary.
author: Robert Greene

text: You can push forward by looking back; you can excavate old knowledge but wield it in a new way.
author: Unknown

text: Facing uncertain environments and wicked problems, breadth of experience is invaluable. Facing kind problems, narrow specialization can be remarkably efficient. The problem is that we often expect the hyper specialist, because of their expertise in a narrow area, to magically be able to extend their skill to wicked problems. The results can be disastrous.
author: Range

text: When you push the boundaries, a lot of it is just probing. It has to be inefficient.
author: Unknown

text: Companies do their most impactful creative work in a crisis, because the disciplinary boundaries fly out of the windows.
author: Range

text: Resource show up when they are needed and normally not beforehand.
The competitor to be feared is one who never bothers about you at all, but goes on making his own business better all the time.
author: Henry Ford
